p: “It is also called “agasyllon”, “criotheos”, or “heliastrus”, and the Romans call it “gutta”. Its smell is similar to castor odor with bitter taste.it has a good color, is not woody, without stones, similar to frankincense in little clots, clear and thick, without filth, this type is called “thrausma” and its earthy or stony kind is called “phurama” [ 51].
